pageContext.claim: “I think that the report yesterday, maybe more importantly than anything, it totally exonerates me. There was no collusion. There was no obstruction. And if you read the report, you'll see that. … And I think that the Mueller investigation has been totally discredited.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The Justice Department inspector general released a report June 14 that found fault with the FBI's handling of the Hillary Clinton email investigation. The 500-page report doesn't delve into Russia's interference in the 2016 election or possible collusion with Trump's campaign, although it does scrutinize anti-Trump texts messages sent by several FBI agents.
